tasks.description: Conduct market research to validate product-market fit, assess competitive landscape, and identify key differentiators and value proposition for the app.
Define user personas, customer segments and ideal customer profile based on market research to inform targeting and positioning.
Develop brand identity, messaging and visual assets (logo, color palette, image style) to establish a compelling, differentiated brand.
Build a marketing website highlighting the app's key features, benefits, and screenshots. Include signup form to build pre-launch email list.
Plan and execute pre-launch awareness campaign via social media, fitness influencer partnerships, and PR to drive app store page visits and preorders.
Optimize app store presence with engaging description, screenshots, demo video, and keywords to maximize discoverability and conversion.
Create referral/invite program and incentives to encourage users to recommend the app to their network and drive viral growth.
Develop content marketing strategy and editorial calendar to attract target customers with valuable fitness content and establish thought leadership.
Launch paid user acquisition campaigns on social media and ad networks post-launch to scale user growth, optimizing for customer acquisition cost.
Implement analytics and reporting to track user acquisition, engagement, retention and revenue metrics. Use insights to continually optimize marketing efforts.
Conduct a survey of 100 people in the target demographic to validate the product concept, assess demand, and identify the most desired features and price sensitivity.
tasks.result:
Here is my plan for executing the task of conducting a survey to validate the AI fitness app concept:

Approach:
1. Define key objectives of the survey (validate concept, assess demand, identify desired features and price points)
2. Determine target sample size of 100 respondents in the target demographic of health-conscious professionals aged 25-45
3. Create a survey questionnaire covering key topics and including a mix of multiple choice and open-ended questions
4. Identify channels to distribute the survey, focusing on places the target audience can be reached (fitness forums, professional networks like LinkedIn, Facebook groups, etc.)
5. Conduct the survey over a 2 week period, tracking progress toward 100 completes
6. Analyze the results, looking at quantitative data as well as reviewing open-ended responses for insights
7. Summarize key findings and recommendations in a report

Actions:
1. Draft a survey questionnaire covering the following:
- Gauge overall appeal of the app concept 
- Assess likelihood to use the app
- Identify which features are most important/appealing
- Determine price sensitivity and willingness to pay
- Understand what would make them download and keep using the app
- Collect demographic info (age, gender, profession, current fitness habits)
2. Set up the survey in a tool like SurveyMonkey or Google Forms
3. Distribute survey via:
- Posts on Reddit forums like r/fitness and r/workouts
- Posts on LinkedIn and in relevant LinkedIn groups 
- Posts in Facebook groups focused on fitness/health
- Promoted posts on Instagram fitness pages
- Emails to fitness/health newsletter lists if available 
4. Monitor survey completes and send reminders/post in more places as needed to reach 100
5. After 2 weeks, close the survey and export the response data
6. Analyze the data, creating charts/graphs of the quantitative results
7. Review open-ended responses, noting any trends or insights
8. Create a summary report in PowerPoint covering:
- Objectives and methodology 
- Respondent demographics
- Key findings: 
-- X% expressed interest in using the app
-- Top 3 most desired features were 1), 2), 3)
-- X% willing to pay $Y/month for premium version
-- Key motivators are M1, M2, M3
- Recommendations
-- Proceed with development, prioritize features X, Y, Z
-- Price at $X/month for premium
-- Focus marketing on messages A, B, C to drive adoption

Outcome:
A 10-15 page PowerPoint report highlighting the survey findings, insights, and recommendations to inform product development and go-to-market planning. The report would validate the overall concept, identify the most critical features to include, suggest target pricing, and provide direction on marketing/positioning.

The survey responses would give the product and business teams the user feedback needed to align the app with market needs and preferences. It would help determine if the concept is on track or needs refinement before investing heavily in development.

Let me know if you need any clarification or have additional questions! I'm happy to refine the plan further.

tasks.description: Analyze the top 5 competing fitness apps to determine their key features, pricing models, user ratings/reviews, and perceived strengths and weaknesses.
Based on the user survey and competitive analysis, define the unique value proposition and 3-5 key differentiators of our app compared to alternatives.
Interview 10 personal trainers and fitness experts to get their feedback on the app concept and feature set, and identify opportunities to make the AI-based recommendations more effective.
Create a one-page summary of the key findings from the market research including validated user needs, competitive positioning, and unique value prop to guide product development and marketing.

context:
The app is a fitness tracking application that uses AI to provide personalized workout recommendations.
    Target audience is health-conscious professionals aged 25-45.
    The app will be available on iOS and Android with a freemium business model.
